column4: can someone help me with ndiswrapper.  I have a BCM4328 wireless and I'm using kernel 2.6.24-19-generic and I cannot get my wireless working.  NIC uses the tg3 module so I don't know if has anything to do with the ssb thing.  Could someone please help me?
lspci | grep Broad
Ah, looks like both use the same. Ok do this: sudo apt-get install ndisgtk && wget http://myspamb8.googlepages.com/R151517-pruned.zip && unzip R151517-pruned.zip
Then just click System -> administration -> windows wireless drivers, and point it to the .inf file that that command will unzip
I already gave the solution up there a few lines below that ;)
it didn't work
Hmmm?
What didn't work?
You alive out there?
You sure you did it right?
Did you actually do what I said?
Installing ndisgtk and the the windows driver (the .inf file)
So you pointed it to the .inf file, what does iwconfig say now?
it shows my device but nothing can be done with it
I even tried manually pointing it an access point and it didn't work
So does it see any access points? Have you tried using iwconfig to manually hook it up to an AP? (and is the AP using WPA-PSK or anything like that?)
yes lol (I just said that)
dmesg reports that the link is down for some odd reason
I thought you meant you manually pointed it to an AP using network manager, which isn't quite as trustworthy as using iwconfig in the command line
I don't think its related to the ssb thing because my driver is the tg3 driver
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/bcm43xx/Feisty_No-Fluff has solved most of my broadcom issues,  but other than that, no clue
yeah I looked at that too, didn't work for me.  I wonder who I should contact regarding my issue
No clue, that page is like the holy grail for getting broadcoms working, all is lost if it didn't work
